p: The accumulated data have shown that the potential anticancer activity of z-guggulsterone is related to the induction of apoptosis. More specifically, z-guggulsterone altered the Bcl-2 family proteins and regulates FXR, NF- ÎºB signaling, MAPK signaling, EGFR, and Jak2-STAT3 signaling pathways in various cancer cells [ 15, 16, 20]. However, the mechanism underlying z-guggulsterone anticancer effects in gastric cancer cells is not completely understood. Here, we showed that z-guggulsterone exerted cytotoxicity on gastric cancer cells through inhibition of FXR signaling. Moreover, the mitochondrial intrinsic apoptosis pathway also participated in the chemotherapy process of z-guggulsterone in gastric cancer.
